sense.name: a state of temporary relief, assistance
sense.examples: The trip to the beach gave John a lift yesterday. After two weeks we finally got a lift from the rain and cold.

sense.name: aerodynamic force that opposed gravity
sense.examples: Lift under their wings is what enables airplanes to fly. The air was too thin to provide the planes with sufficient lift for take-off.

sense.name: a state of being elevated or raised
sense.examples: What caused the sudden lift in oil prices this week? Volcanic activity caused the lift that you see on the other side of the valley. Scientists have observed a small but distinct lift in the earth's temperature. The earthquake caused a visible lift that rippled along the fault line. The barometer is indicating a steady lift in pressure.

sense.name: a ski tow
sense.examples: We took a chair lift up the side of the mountain. The children are being towed up the hill by a surface lift.

sense.name: small devices worn inside shoes for support or height
sense.examples: The man wore a lift in his left shoe because his left leg was shorter than his right. John wears lifts in his shoes to make himself taller.

sense.name: a component layer which makes up the heel of a boot or shoe
sense.examples: The heels of these boots are made of a stack of ten lifts. The bottom layer of a shoe heel is called the top lift.

sense.name: an elevator
sense.examples: We took the stairs because the lift in the hotel was not working. Does this lift go to the garage level?

sense.name: cosmetic surgery
sense.examples: She's had two lifts done around her eyes and one under her chin. The cosmetic surgeon is doing a bust lift on the woman.

sense.name: an organized, large-scale transport or movement of cargo
sense.examples: They evacuated most of the refugees via lifts before the enemy army took the city. The only way to get medical supplies and food to those villages is by lift.

sense.name: an impromptu ride in a car
sense.examples: She gave me a lift to the grocery store. Pete can get a lift to the hotel with Mary.

sense.name: the act of physically raising something
sense.examples: The gym teacher had them do twenty leg lifts. He glanced at her with a lift of his eyebrow. The pairs skaters are practicing their lifts on the ice.

sense.name: an act of stealing or plagiarizing
sense.examples: This passage clearly proves that her story is a straight lift from Jane Austen. The locked glass cased are to prevent lifts of the diamond jewelry on display there.

sense.name: an amount of weight, a load that can be carried
sense.examples: How many pounds is the lift of that bulldozer? They weighed the cargo jet to see whether the lift in its hold was over the limit.
